    • Method Detail

      • useLineDrawingMode

        public void useLineDrawingMode()
        for images which are already line drawings, that is images such as maps with only lines, or for block images, use this to avoid a gap filling stage that fills single pixel gaps surrounded by non-zero pixels. (Else, the filter applies such a gap filling algorithm to help avoid creating bubbles in thick lines).
        Specified by:
        useLineDrawingMode in interface ILineThinner

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean setToDebug)
        Description copied from interface: ILineThinner
        turn on the extra output to help debugging. this includes plot displays with awt, html output and additional logging
        Specified by:
        setDebug in interface ILineThinner

      • createCoordinatePointsForEightNeighbors

        public void rotateBy90(algorithms.util.PairInt[][] neighborCoords)

      • doesDisconnect

        protected boolean doesDisconnect(algorithms.util.PairInt p,
                                 java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> points,
                                 java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> overridePointsAdded,
                                 java.util.Set<algorithms.util.PairInt> overridePointsRemoved,
                                 int imageWidth,
                                 int imageHeight)
        for the full 8 neighbor region, determine whether nulling the pixel at (col, row) would disconnect the remaining line. Note that the boolean logic is embedded in the comments. One should be able to combine the rules for multiple pixel tests to reduce the redundant comparisons for the regions in common. Note, that row and col are expected to be at least 1 pixel distant from the image borders.
        Returns:

      • hasAtLeastOneBorderPixel
